reviewText: Expected Car Mechanic Simulator 2015 but with tractors. Ended up being Car Mechanic Simulator 2014 with tractors. The difference is that there is no free play" in the sense that you are forced one job after an other and that's it while in Car Mechanic Simulator 2015 you can actually stack up jobs
date:
choose the ones you want and ignore the ones you don't want.

This makes all the difference for me. Played it 30mins and uninstalled it.

That should be listed as a DLC for Car Mechanic Simulator 2014 and not have 2015 in its name which indicates it's the same basic principle as Car Mechanic Simulator 2015 and it most certainly is not."

reviewText:
It's a fun, decent game that’s built using the CMS 2014 engine. It plays just like it and not like CMS 2015. The graphics are detailed and look great. I continue to be impressed with PlayWays art department and their attention to detail. The gameplay is pretty much standard fare for the mechanic sim genre. I would've liked to have seen more parts to unbolt or disassemble. Some of the parts just click off and require no wrenching. I get the fine line between fun and tedium, but it is labeled as a “simulator” after all. If you're a fan of CMS 2014 and haven't played CMS 2015 yet, you should feel right at home with this one.

Farm" Mechanic
+ Good textures
date: lighting and models\n+ Interesting niche idea
recommended:
and a kudos to the dev's for branching the genre out
+ Detailed parts and equipment

"Harm" Mechanic
- Some sounds and music can get a little annoying
- Would've been better if built on the CMS 2015 engine
- Doesn't come with a straw hat

reviewText: A lot more enjoyable than I had expected.  Note, this is my first-ever 3D mechanic" type game.\n\nIt's effectively an appealing 3D puzzle
date: heavy on the theme "farm equipment."  No issues to report
recommended: the game is (as of Oct 2015) bug free and looks great.\n\nWould appreciate even more depth though
hoursPlayed: such as:\n\n- More equipment to repair.  There are 4 tractor types and one combine
voteText: but the tractors all share the same parts on the inside.\n- More part types per machine (for instance
votesHelpful: which are ignored)\n- More of a challenge to wring every last dollar out of each repair.  You have the choice to replace a part with a new or good-condition new one from a catalog
votesTotal: or repair it.  Repairing it yourself is always
commentsCount: the best option.  There should be some cases where this isn't so.  I mean
column16:
is it truly possible to bring a damaged part to 100% economically?  Not in real life.
- More textures.  Why should a new part come with dents and scratches just like a used part?  In reality the difference is often obvious.

Great fun
column17: and not that expensive as it is today.  I also look forward to a future version of this game with more depth.\n"

reviewText:
Having never played one of these games before and getting a review copy of 'Car Mechanic Sim 2015' I expressed my appreciation to the dev's for my new found love for this style of game.....

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rKyMEa-lJ1E

Well they sent me a couple more of their games so here's another non-biased video. Be your own boss! Enjoy your new career at an authentic farm repair service with Farm Mechanic Simulator 2015. This game gives you a fascinating insight into life of a countryside mechanical facility. Prepare yourself for big adventures with big machines. It's better than reality! - Recommended!

reviewText: Truck Mechanic 2015 meets the farm. Minimal help, poor economic model, tedious 'Where's Waldo' searching for defective parts on very small unprofitable jobs. Very little difference except color in tractors and combines. f you like boring, repetitive, frustrating games, this is for you. There is no reward for good work. You earn money by selling the used parts you take off the boring tractors and combines you repair.\n\nWith the fun of Car Mechanic 2014 and improvements in Car Mechanic 2015, I expected better from the publisher. This game is not a worthy successor to either game. If it was $5 US it may be worth it. Otherwise, spend your money elsewhere. At job 75 it kicks you out and you're done. No replay value. Sandbox garages just more of the same.  It's your money, spend it wisely.
